{"inputs": {"tag": "devhub-platform", "name": "DevHub Platform", "admins": ["theori.near", "efiz.near"], "handle": "devhub-platform", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreigivabiaog2s2qgfsuhyrl7f4jmpdwelsv2jmga6jfdbocsrbgv5i", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform.", "bio_markdown": "A community of product & technical contributors focusing on delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform that empower NEAR developers to thrive and contribute."}}
{"community": "devhub-platform"}

{"handle": "devhub-platform", "community": {"tag": "devhub-platform", "name": "DevHub Platform", "addons": [{"id": "o9p934", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "telegram", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"handles\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"https://t.me/devhubplatform\\\\\\\"]}", "display_name": "Telegram"}, {"id": "p56v0f", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# \\\\u{1f44b} Welcome!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis community is all about delivering high impact features to the [NEAR DevHub Platform](http://neardevhub.org), a decentralized community platform for NEAR developers to contribute to the ecosystem and stay informed. This space aims to serve as an entry point to individuals, experts, and organizations who are interested in contributing. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Our Groups\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe have two main groups:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 1. Working group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a group of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to the DevHub Platform. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO, and hold grant takers accountable. They also engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- @frol.near\\\\\\\\n- @ori.near\\\\\\\\n- @bo.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 2. Community contributors\\\\\\\\nWe have a core group of regular product & technical community contributors who regularly work on making the DevHub platform better, from contributing code to reporting and triaging issues. These individuals collaborate across different time zones using lightweight and mostly asynchronous processes. To learn more about how we work, check out our project [README](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets#how-to-contribute) page on GitHub.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## What are we working on?\\\\\\\\nTo track our progress and manage issues effectively, we use a [Kanban board](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60/views/1). You can also check out our [current](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets/milestones) and [past](https://github.com/near/neardevhub-widgets/milestones?state=closed) initiatives.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Communication channels\\\\\\\\nWe use the following channels for communication:\\\\\\\\n- [GitHub:](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60/views/1) For specific issues and pull requests. Enable notifications to ensure you get the latest updates.\\\\\\\\n- [Telegram:](https://t.me/devhubplatform) For general questions or concerns.\\\\\\\\n- [Weekly Standup Calls](https://bit.ly/DevHubCalendar): To align on priorities and discuss progress, plans, and blockers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How to get involved\\\\\\\\nAnyone is welcome to contribute to the DevHub platform. Here are ways to get involved:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Contribute code**: Review the list of [good first issues](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/contribute). You can pick any issues from the [Backlog column](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/60) and indicate your interest by leaving comments. Before you get started, we encourage you to check out [how we work](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/blob/main/docs/how-we-work.md) and the [developer guidelines](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).\\\\\\\\n* **Report issues**: To report a [bug](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues/new?assignees=&labels=bug&template=bug_report.md&title=) or a [feature request](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues/new?assignees=&labels=enhancement&template=feature-request.md&title=), please review all open and closed [issues](https://github.com/near/devgigsboard-widgets/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aall+) to make sure no one has previously created a similar topic. If you have a more robust proposal or idea that you\\\\\\'d like to discuss, you are also welcome to create an idea or solution post on our community here.\\\\\\\\n* **Triage issues**: You are welcome to help us triage by verifying or reproducing bugs, adding more specific reproduction instructions, or voting on issues by adding a \\\\u{1f44d} thumbs-up reaction to the issue\\\\\\'s description comment.  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to become a paid contributor\\\\\\\\nAs an an open-source project, we greatly approach the contributions of each individual. We aim to grow an ecosystem of developers who are here because they like the technology and community. Given that there\\\\u{2019}s a lot of time and effort that goes into this, we have financial means to compensate for some activities and projects for regular contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you are interested in getting compensate for contributing your skills and expertise to our project, the best way to get started is to first familiarize yourself with [DevHub](https://www.neardevhub.org) and start getting involved (see section above). Once you\\\\u{2019}ve gained the community\\\\u{2019}s trust by demonstrating high-quality contributions and ongoing commitment, you can [apply here](https://near.social/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=507). \\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Overview"}], "admins": ["theori.near", "efiz.near"], "handle": "devhub-platform", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreigivabiaog2s2qgfsuhyrl7f4jmpdwelsv2jmga6jfdbocsrbgv5i", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform.", "website_url": "neardevhub.org", "bio_markdown": "A community of product & technical contributors focusing on delivering high impact features to the DevHub Platform that empower NEAR developers to thrive and contribute.", "github_handle": "/near/neardevhub-widgets/tree/main", "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": "https://t.me/devhubplatform"}}

{"data": {"devhub-platform.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "DevHub Platform", "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreigivabiaog2s2qgfsuhyrl7f4jmpdwelsv2jmga6jfdbocsrbgv5i"}}}}}

{"inputs": {"tag": "fellowship", "name": "NEAR Platform Fellowship", "admins": ["frol.near", "bo.near"], "handle": "fellowship", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreibysr2mkwhb4j36h2t7mqwhynqdy4vzjfygfkfg65kuspd2bawauu", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Fellowship Program to grow contributions to NEAR Platform", "bio_markdown": "DevDAO\\\\\\'s paid program offers financial rewards to experienced NEAR developers and newcomers for their contributions to the NEAR Platform (blockchain and devtools). [Learn more](https://bit.ly/4507tna)"}}
{"community": "fellowship"}

{"handle": "fellowship", "community": {"tag": "fellowship", "name": "NEAR Platform Fellowship", "addons": [{"id": "d1wywg", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO\\\\\\'s paid program offers financial rewards to experienced NEAR developers and newcomers for their contributions to NEAR Platform (blockchain, devtools, documentation). By collaborating on the developer productivity tools for NEAR\\\\u{2019}s Blockchain Operating System [BOS], Zero Knowledge [ZK], and Smart Contracts, community members can foster innovation and enrich our developer community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Why is it needed?\\\\\\\\nAs the NEAR ecosystem grows rapidly, there is an increasing need to improve developer productivity. While open-source communities are essential to manage these needs, new developers may find it challenging to get started. The DevDAO NEAR Platform Fellowship Program aims to solve this issue by providing guidance to new contributors from experienced developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### What are the focus areas?\\\\\\\\nDevDAO focuses on improving work in the following strategic areas within the NEAR ecosystem:\\\\\\\\n- Blockchain Operating System implementation\\\\\\\\n- Zero Knowledge SDK\\\\\\\\n- JavaScript on-chain and off-chain SDK\\\\\\\\n- Rust on-chain and off-chain SDK\\\\\\\\n- Mobile development (native iOS/Android, and cross-platform frameworks like Flutter)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWithin each area, there are a number of tasks to complete, including developing security and contract development toolkits, creating productivity tools, and maintaining open-source repositories. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO wants to prioritize contributions to the following repositories: \\\\\\\\n- [docs](https://github.com/near/docs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-api-js](https://github.com/near/near-api-js)\\\\\\\\n- [near-jsonrpc-client-rs](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-cli-rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-cli](https://github.com/near/near-cli)\\\\\\\\n- [near-sdk-rs](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [near-sdk-js](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-js)\\\\\\\\n- [workspaces-rs](https://github.com/near/workspaces-rs)\\\\\\\\n- [workspaces-js](https://github.com/near/workspaces-js)\\\\\\\\n- [wallet-selector](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector)\\\\\\\\n- [create-near-app](https://github.com/near/create-near-app)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How does it work?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO\\\\\\'s NEAR Platform Fellowship Program is a way for active and experienced NEAR developers to empower new contributors and solve the focus areas above. Here\\\\u{2019}s it works: \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. **Apply**: Experienced contributors apply to become a Fellowship Leader by submitting a proposal on DevHub. The proposal must include a timeline, budget to allocate to new contributors, and a focus area.\\\\\\\\n2. **Approve**: DevDAO and the NEAR community review the proposal to ensure that it aligns with the NEAR community goals and that the budget is reasonable.\\\\\\\\n3. **Invite**: Upon acceptance, the Fellowship Leader invites new contributors to participate in the project. The Fellowship Leader is responsible for evaluating and negotiating compensation (see [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines)) with the new contributors. \\\\\\\\n4. **Execute**: Once the team is assembled, they can begin working on the project. \\\\\\\\n5. **Compensate**: Once the work is complete, contributors submit their contribution report on DevHub. The Fellowship Leader must provide an attestation to confirm the work and compensation amount. DevDAO will then work to issue the payment.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo help bootstrap the program, DevDAO invites experienced developers to apply from various expert entities such as Pagoda, Aurora, Proximity, Human Guild, and Calimero. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to submit a fellowship proposal?\\\\\\\\nSubmit a fellowship proposal on the [NEAR DevHub](http://neardevhub.org) using these guidelines:\\\\\\\\n- Create a new \\\\u{201c}Solution\\\\u{201d} post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the \\\\u{201c}fellowship\\\\u{201d} and \\\\u{201c}fellowship-proposal\\\\u{201d} labels to your post.\\\\\\\\n- Provide a clear description of the project goals, scope, deliverables, and timeline.\\\\\\\\n- Describe the skills and experience you are looking for from new contributors.\\\\\\\\n- Set a budget for your fellowship using the [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines). Note that the compensation will get paid directly from DevDAO to contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOnce you have submitted your proposal, the DevDAO team will review it and provide feedback. If your proposal is approved, you can start recruiting fellow contributors.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to be a great fellowship leader?\\\\\\\\nAs a Fellowship Leader, your role is crucial in empowering successful contributions to our ecosystem. To be an effective leader, it is essential to perform several key tasks:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Define the scope of work**: Submit a well-defined proposal with clear goals.\\\\\\\\n- **Find contributors**: Utilize networking, various community groups, and applications left on DevHub as comments to your proposal to find contributors.\\\\\\\\n- **Onboard contributors**: Set clear expectations, including your availability and communication guidelines. Additionally, provide well-defined tasks with the relevant context and acceptance criteria.\\\\\\\\n- **Oversee execution**: Deliver quality results that meet the needs of our ecosystem by monitoring the project, providing feedback to contributors, and promptly responding to questions.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to be a great contributor?\\\\\\\\nNew contributors play an essential role in our ecosystem, bringing fresh perspectives and ideas. If you\\\\u{2019}re looking to make meaningful contributions and gain guidance from experienced developers, here are some tips to help you get started:  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Apply to a fellowship**: Find [available fellowship proposals on NEAR DevHub](/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Feed?label=fellowship-proposal) and leave a comment with your application for a project that interests you.\\\\\\\\n- **Align with your Fellowship Leader**: If you are selected, it is important to align with your Fellowship Leader on the expectations and requirements for the project.\\\\\\\\n- **Be self-sufficient**: While your Fellowship Leader is there to guide you, it is important to become self-sufficient quickly and focus on completing your work. This means taking initiative to learn and communicating when you need support.\\\\\\\\n- **Provide updates**: Post a contribution report on DevHub to provide transparency and potentially to get compensated.\\\\\\\\n- **Keep improving**: As you gain more knowledge and experience, we hope that you continue to contribute to our ecosystem and share your insights to enable others to contribute too.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to submit a contribution report?\\\\\\\\nTo ensure transparency and accountability, DevDAO requires all contributors to submit a contribution report on the [NEAR DevHub](http://neardevhub.org) once the work is complete using these guidelines:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Create a new \\\\u{201c}Solution\\\\u{201d} post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the \\\\u{201c}fellowship\\\\u{201d} and \\\\u{201c}contribution-report\\\\u{201d} labels to your post.\\\\\\\\n- Add the requested compensation amount\\\\\\\\n- In the description, reference the relevant fellowship proposal post. And list your contributions with references (e.g. PRs, issues, etc), the time spent, and [the factors to consider when determining the compensation amount](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOnce you have submitted your contribution report, your Fellowship Leader must reply to it with an attestation confirming that the report is accurate and that they are offering a certain amount of their pre-approved budget.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDevDAO will keep track of the attestations and take appropriate action to approve the payment unless there are any concerns raised.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### What does DevDAO expect in the short term?\\\\\\\\nOver the next three months, DevDAO aims to board 10 fellowship leaders who will help us establish and scale this program. We welcome feedback from the community, so please share your thoughts by replying to this post.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo learn more about the DevDAO goals, check out [the recently posted OKRs](/#/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.Post?id=531). Together, we can build a community where developers share ideas, collaborate on projects, and learn from each other.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About"}], "admins": ["frol.near", "bo.near"], "handle": "fellowship", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreibysr2mkwhb4j36h2t7mqwhynqdy4vzjfygfkfg65kuspd2bawauu", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreic4xgorjt6ha5z4s5e3hscjqrowe5ahd7hlfc5p4hb6kdfp6prgy4", "description": "Fellowship Program to grow contributions to NEAR Platform", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "DevDAO\\\\\\'s paid program offers financial rewards to experienced NEAR developers and newcomers for their contributions to the NEAR Platform (blockchain and devtools). [Learn more](https://bit.ly/4507tna)", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": null}}

{"data": {"fellowship.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "NEAR Platform Fellowship", "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreibysr2mkwhb4j36h2t7mqwhynqdy4vzjfygfkfg65kuspd2bawauu"}}}}}

{"inputs": {"tag": "devrel", "name": "Decentralized DevRel", "admins": ["victorkanu1.near", "bpolania.near", "pivortex.near"], "handle": "devrel", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreignlfyjejbvnclxbkiybjejjjqgelvrjyqxd4gscb2maoy3qw7ame", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicic7xwcw4no6kqpcqlhe3hcszlkfp5u53yw5a4x4lap3uzlndbcm", "description": "Providing community management and support to developers", "bio_markdown": "A group of community contributors who engage with the NEAR developer community, gather feedback, and coordinate community calls and events."}}
{"community": "devrel"}

{"handle": "devrel", "community": {"tag": "devrel", "name": "Decentralized DevRel", "addons": [{"id": "hq1s0t", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Developer Relations at near/dev/hub \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"## About Us \\\\u{1f3c6}\\\\\\\\nWe are a dynamic team of community contributors dedicated to fostering the growth of the NEAR developer community. Our mission goes beyond engagement; we actively support developers through education, seamless onboarding, and collaborative development with NEAR\\\\\\'s open web stack. From gathering valuable feedback to orchestrating community calls and events, our commitment is to empower you as a developer and facilitate your journey in unlocking the full potential of NEAR Protocol.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## The Team \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. @bpolania.near\\\\\\\\n   \\\\\\\\n   Areas of Contribution: Head of DevRel , Coordinating NEAR Campus.\\\\\\\\n   \\\\\\\\n2. @victorkanu1.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n   Areas of Contribution: Developer onboarding / engagement, Technical writing, workshops, Coordinating African initiatives, Hackathons. \\\\\\\\n   \\\\\\\\n3. @pivortex.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\tAreas of Contribution: Discord Support, Hosting workshops, Office Hours, Regional DevRel Support, Hackathons.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t\\\\\\\\n4. @orangejoe.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    Areas of Contribution: Developer Retention , Developer Onboarding, Developer Support. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t\\\\\\\\n5. @josecouto.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    Areas of Contribution: DevHub Marketing , Twitter Management, Hackathons.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n   \\\\\\\\n6. @Flmel.near  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n     Areas of Contribution: Developer Support, Documentation, Tooling, Office Hours.\\\\\\\\n  \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Meet the team "}, {"id": "9uriqz", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blog", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "For You "}, {"id": "ftd6ha", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Office Hours \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\nNEAR Developer Office Hours are held several times a week by DevHub or other community groups, and are a great way to level up your NEAR development or just meet other developers in the community! We host office hours on the NEAR [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/zfhfRpaM4m), which is also a great place to ask questions via chat!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThursdays: 11:00 \\\\u{2013} 12:00 UTC (1PM-2PM CEST) / Europe , Africa , Asia \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThursdays: 18:00 \\\\u{2013} 19:00 UTC (11AM-12PM PST) / Americas\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDaily: BuildDAO (Banyan) BOS Office Hours (w/ DevHub on Wed): 15:00 UTC\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFridays: NEAR Horizon Office Hours (Business Oriented) 16:00-17:00 UTC\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDaily: Chinese Developer Office Hours 12:00-13:00 UTC (20:00 CST) Tencent Meet\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nGo to [Office Hours](https://discord.com/invite/zfhfRpaM4m)\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Office hours / Support "}, {"id": "z2f3vh", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\" A Developer\\\\\\'s Guide to Active Participation in the DevHub\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**The DevHub Platform is your homebase for connecting with other developers and mentors, sharing ideas, proposing events, accessing resources, and finding communities working on diverse projects \\\\u{2013} from protocol development to tooling and documentation**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Ways to Participate \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **Join a Community:** Explore communities [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities).\\\\\\\\n- **Improve NEAR Documentation:** Contribute on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/docs).\\\\\\\\n- **Seek Mentorship:** Check out Office hours hosted on Discord and connect with all DevRels via our DevRel Telegram.\\\\\\\\n- **Host an Event/Hackathon:** Wunna host an event / hackathon? Power it up with [Hackbox](https://near.social/hackbox.near/widget/home).\\\\\\\\n- **Join NEAR Campus:** To support your blockchain club / university...Be part of [NEAR Campus](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=near-campus).\\\\\\\\n- **Post a Proposal:** Got an idea you\\\\\\'ll like to bring to the Ecosystem? Use this [Guide](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=203)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### How to Stay Updated:\\\\\\\\nSubscribe to our [newsletter](https://newsletter.neardevhub.org/) and join the Telegram group for the latest updates.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Get Involved:\\\\\\\\nRegardless of your background or wherever you are in the world, we invite you to explore, find your community, and discover paths to contribute that are most gratifying for you. Let\\\\\\'s build the open web together!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "How to use DevHub? \\\\u{1f914}"}], "admins": ["victorkanu1.near", "bpolania.near", "pivortex.near"], "handle": "devrel", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreignlfyjejbvnclxbkiybjejjjqgelvrjyqxd4gscb2maoy3qw7ame", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreicic7xwcw4no6kqpcqlhe3hcszlkfp5u53yw5a4x4lap3uzlndbcm", "description": "Providing community management and support to developers", "website_url": null, "bio_markdown": "A group of community contributors who engage with the NEAR developer community, gather feedback, and coordinate community calls and events.", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": "+niaMtWIjY3ZlZTVh"}}

{"data": {"devrel.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Decentralized DevRel", "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreignlfyjejbvnclxbkiybjejjjqgelvrjyqxd4gscb2maoy3qw7ame"}}}}}

{"inputs": {"tag": "near-campus", "name": "Near Campus", "admins": ["8566fc4bb16e1a7446b5e9b1b8aea94b5751d5f8c658d7af18d8cdf642d7b31d", "bpolania.near"], "handle": "near-campus", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreib45plxkuy6wcefachijuq2dm4jnfs4236yhfleehqboeeljpmxje", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreib3tucyqaj6u6x6n5b45xqrvqyjm4l2xpwhousw5mxvfqocdgastu", "description": "Educational Program that aims to support Blockchain clubs.", "bio_markdown": "NEAR Devhub program intended to support existing Student Blockchain Clubs with resources, mentorships, and other collaboration opportunities. "}}
{"community": "near-campus"}

{"handle": "near-campus", "community": {"tag": "near-campus", "name": "Near Campus", "addons": [{"id": "a0fxp3", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About Us\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevHub\\\\u{2019}s NEAR Campus supports existing student clubs, researchers, and faculties in blockchain technologies, enhancing both curricular and extracurricular activities.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Blockchain & Education:** Academia is recognizing Blockchain\\\\u{2019}s broad impact. NEAR\\\\\\'s contributions are facilitating global curriculum integration and research initiatives, focusing on refining existing norms, and highlighting its influence!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe aim to merge blockchain education with mainstream academics, enabling participants to undertake innovative projects and excel in decentralized application development and research.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"center\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About us"}, {"id": "c64vnb", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to Join\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Step by Step\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"* Having a Blockchain club with history of activities;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* Setting up a call with NC team to present your club and learn more about the program;\\\\\\\\n(Set up a call [Here](https://calendly.com/nearcampus) adding the name of your club/University at the description)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* Creating a 3 months proposal that includes info about the club, proposed activities, timeline and KPIs;\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n* Being approved after review;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* Posting the proposal at Near Social to the whole community;\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n* Completing KYC;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* Ready to start!
